item.title: Recovering kubeconfig for a Cluster Created with RHACM
item.description: Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes and it’s upstream Open Cluster Management automate cluster lifecycle management from creation, configuration, upgrade, and destruction. If a cluster is created by RHACM you may need to download the kubeadmin password and the kubeconfig. This is easily accomplished by browsing to the RHACM cluster overview, but how do you do the same from the CLI? ClusterDeployment The creation of a cluster starts with a ClusterDeployment which will be interpreted by Hive.
